title: Mum-of-7 must to have Christmas in October after she's given two weeks to live
text:

A loving husband is setting up Christmas decorations in his wife's hospice room so her kids can enjoy the festive season with mum two months early.

Mum-of-seven Helen Robinson managed to beat breast cancer last year but now the disease has returned and spread to her lungs.

It means the 46-year-old has just weeks to live and she will have very early October Christmas, report the Liverpool Echo.

Her devoted husband Stephen has set up an online fundraising campaign to raise money to pay for her funeral and get their three youngest children - Ellie, 13, Sophie, 10, and Jessica, 8 - some early Christmas presents.

(Image: Liverpool ECHO)

Last week Helen moved to St John's Hospice, next to Clatterbridge Cancer Centre in the Wirral where she is receiving only palliative care.

The mum has does a lot of charity work and pioneered Trauma Teddies, which are cuddly toys placed in Merseyside Police's armed response vehicles to give to children at the scenes of crime.

Today, husband Stephen, 49, spoke to the ECHO and described his wife as "very poorly".

The former shop worker said: "Helen has been in the hospice for just a week, but she's gone downhill quickly.

(Image: handout)

"The news has just been devastating... we've been together since school days, married more than 30 years.

"Helen has brought the kids up so well, and she's the kind of person who would go out her way to help someone."

She now struggles to walk and can often feel nauseous.

Writing to his friends and family, Stephen said: "Please help!

"Helen's time is running out, it’s now weeks, let me give her the send off she deserves to ease the pressure on the kids.

(Image: Liverpool ECHO)

"Helen is stressed, she wants to go in peace without worrying, anything is gratefully appreciated."

And the former Cadbury's factory worker added: "I’ve cried many times as we have been together since we were young teens and married since our early 20s.

"She is the love of my life and I just don’t know what I’m going to do.

"We have seven kids, four are grown up, but we have little girls aged 8, 10 and 13 - it’s going to be devastating for them and I really don’t know what to do.

(Image: handout)

"I’m trying to raise some funds to help the kids to have a special Christmas with their mum one last time and trying to raise funds to help cover her funeral which is going to cost around £5,000.

"It’s been a long battle for Helen she is tired now and very poorly and I’m worried how long we have left with Helen."

So far, in just three weeks, £800 has been raised.
description: Helen Robinson, 46, beat breast cancer last year but has now been given the tragic news that cancer has spread around her lungs
